isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RT-6613 SERIES - AIR SYSTEM - INSERT VALVE

svcproc.title: INSERT VALVE
svcproc.para: The insert valve located in the intermediate shift cylinder cover is a small 1-3/16 inch Humphrey valve. It is installed with the flat surface to the inside. It is secured h a special nut in the bottom bore of the cover.
When installing the insert valve, apply Dow Corning #200 lubricant or its equivalent to the cylinder walls. When installing special nut, apply Loctite hydraulic sealant to the threads.
The insert valve is self-contained and cannot be disassembled except for the three O-rings on the outer diameter. These three O-rings are a stationary seal and do not move in the cylinder.

Travel of the small piston in the insert valve is only 3/16 inch. The insert valve is a normally open valve. Thus, when there is no signal or delivery of air to the top side of the insert piston, the constant air from the regulator passes through the insert valve and to the back side of the piston and moves shift bar forward (low) ( Figure 5).

When the insert valve piston is activated by a signal or delivery of air, the insert valve is closed and shuts off the constant air to the back side of the shift piston. Air in the shift cylinder is exhausted out the insert valve and bottom bore of the cover ( Figure 6).
When air is removed from the back side of the shift piston, constant air on the front side of the shift piston moves the shift bar to the rear (intermediate and direct).
